conclusion: Analyze forces on the metal rod with currents I_1 and I_2.
Mass of the rod is m; gravitational force is mg.
Rod is in equilibrium; weight mg balanced by spring tension 2kx.
Current I_1 causes magnetic force F_B1 = I_1 L B upwards.
Magnetic force I_1 L B balances weight mg: I_1 L B = mg.
Current I_2 causes magnetic force F_B2 = I_2 L B upwards.
F_B2 > mg, causing springs to elongate.
Using I_1 L B = mg, express net force: I_2 L B - I_1 L B = 2kΔx.
Solve for Δx: Δx = (I_2 - I_1) L B / 2k.
